intro: Gronophyllum manusii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and used in traditional medicine. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a valuable resource for indigenous communities.
